comment: He is a great professor! Very caring and understanding about students, especially during the pandemic. 3 midterms with 2 attempts for each (highest attempts are counted) and he drops the lowest midterm grade. Final also has 2 attempts. The midterms are open note, stay open for about 2 days, and don't have a time limit (atleast during COVID it was)

Such a caring and kind man. His tests are open note and you get two attempts for every test. He wants you to succeed and makes sure that you understand everything. Take him for whatever classes he offers, you won't regret it!
He is my FAVORITE professor I have had at KSU!!! All of the assignments are completely doable, but you will really understand the material. He takes time to answer questions and is very caring!

BEST PHYSICS PROFESSOR! Actually cared about us understanding the material and less stressing about our grades. He basically wants you to succeed and not worry about your grade. TAKE HIM! He is very understanding and honestly the best STEM professor I have ever taken.

PHENOMENAL professor!! One of the best professors at KSU!! He truly wants everyone in the class to understand and succeed in every aspect of the course. I took his class for physics 1111 and 1112 and arranged my schedule around his courses.

He made physics one of the easiest classes. His lectures are boring and he is monotone, but he will have the EXACT questions on the test. You can have a note card or paper for the exam. Gives loads of extra credit for the test. All you need to do is the minimum. Don't let this be the class you get a B or lower grade in.

He was literally awesome!!!! Each exam was automatically graded out of 120 which means you already have 20 extra possible points and 1 exam gets dropped. The final was out of 135 points!!! so we had 35 extra points; we had webassign homework but that wasn't bad at all. You literally can't fail this man's class. Easy A for me and best prof at KSU
He is the absolute BEST!! Its basically impossible to fail his class and I would most definitely take his class again and/or have him as a professor!!!

He goes really fast and doesn't understand that the whole class is lost, but he gives so much extra credit on tests, that it's easy to miss class and still do well. There's a lot of online homework and pop quizzes in breakout sessions, but as long as you show up and put in even a little effort, you'll be fine. As physics profs go, he's not bad!

He gives you plenty of opportunity to do well in his class. I was able to completely turn my grade around after bombing the first 2 exams. His notes are very helpful. Lets you know what specific sections to focus on when studying for a test. He posts the notes online as well. You will definitely not regret having Dr. Kaboudian as a professor.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Kaboudian's exams range from 13-15 multiple choice questions, but he only grades out of 10 which means you could get up to 130-150 points on his exams. He assigns a lot of problems on Webassign, and he teaches lecture from the powerpoint that he posts online. Breakout sessions are mandatory because he gives participation quizzes.
